In a joint message, @TonyJuniper from @NaturalEngland,
@EmmaHowardBoyd from @EnvAgency and @williamrworsley from @ForestryEngland have declared that this must be the year we ramp up action on climate change and #NatureRecovery.

#TogetherForOurPlanet
https://t.co/imv3CfNn6I

Very important to support & respect our #drainage and #floodmanagement key workers who help protect people, property & the environment, especially at this time of year, whilst the rest of us stay at home. @ADA_updates @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WaterUK @LGAcomms #idbs @CMO_England

tweets.text:
Quagga mussels are an invasive non-native species and have recently been found in the #RiverTrent.

They can spread rapidly and block pipes.

Help us prevent this: check, clean and dry your equipment and footwear after spending time around watercourses. 
https://t.co/yvjXsvp14v https://t.co/xuYv9GXUrF

urls.description: Rapid decreases in water temperature may result in a number of physiological, behavioural and fitness consequences for fishes termed ‚Äòcold shock‚Äô. Cold‚Äêshock stress occurs when a fish has been acclim...

tweets.text:
@Bull_of_the_Bog @BeidaiheBirder @eastern_ifca @EnvAgency I would be careful making a judgement

https://t.co/vDWY4qVwAs
@BeidaiheBirder @eastern_ifca @EnvAgency Thanks Mark, yes pretty small say about 6 inches. Does seem most likely explanation which if it is the case is rather sad.
@timthefruit @JamieMc76633051 @GeorgeMonbiot @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @HelenStace_HWT Probably.
@Rosewood_Farm @JamieMc76633051 @GeorgeMonbiot @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @HelenStace_HWT I think we are basically both singing from the same hymn sheet.
Wreck of hundreds of Flatfish on Old Hunstanton beach, along with Sea Urchins & Starfish. Any thoughts on cause ? @eastern_ifca @EnvAgency https://t.co/EK0vpOHCcj
@timthefruit @JamieMc76633051 @GeorgeMonbiot @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @HelenStace_HWT compensation for a cheap food policy in the UK, not a subsidy to support farming.

@timthefruit @JamieMc76633051 @GeorgeMonbiot @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @HelenStace_HWT I don't think we can say for sure what ELMS is at the moment but all it's predecessors have acted more like compensation for economic loss rather than subsidy. You have to consider the impact that removing the subsidy would have. It is also, basically, acting more like

@Rosewood_Farm @JamieMc76633051 @GeorgeMonbiot @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @HelenStace_HWT But ELMS is a subsidy. Don't get me wrong I have no problem with public money for public goods in fact I support it. But the question remains how many farms in UK would be financially viable without any input of public funds?

The majority of Earth's chalk streams & rivers are found in England; fragile, extraordinary ecologies.
But they're dying from water company over-extraction, pollution & @EnvAgency inaction.
@Feargal_Sharkey is leading an event (8 Dec) on stopping the rot.
https://t.co/znRcXVS58x
Government gives farmers go-ahead to use bee-killing pesticide that's banned in the EU: https://t.co/a9YKmv6fx8

@JamieMc76633051 @timthefruit @GeorgeMonbiot @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @HelenStace_HWT Hopefully #ELMS will be that mechanism, but until we know the details it's difficult to say whether it is or isn't going to achieve that.
@Bull_of_the_Bog @eastern_ifca @EnvAgency Do you have a rough idea of the general size Steve ? Undersized fish/bycatch?
@Donna_Dean @eastern_ifca @EnvAgency Thanks I've often seen Kites scavenging/hunting beaches, but not today.  Curious that most of the dead fish were same size (age?)
